meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jennifer Hill Rony Josaphat Vito Cortese Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6014.

td.p: Jennifer Hill, a Korean studies program coordinator from Washington, D.C.
Rony Josaphat, a master's student of television from North Miami, Florida
Vito Cortese, a software engineer and Italian translator from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (whose 1-day cash winnings total $21,685)

tr.td: 20th CENTURY HISTORY
OPRAH'S GUESTS
TOP SELLER IN THE U.S.
COMPLETE THE BIBLE QUOTE
SAY THE MAGIC WORDS
SILLY RHYMES
(Alex: Each correct response will rhyme with "silly".)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'The British shortened this term to "bolshie", which also came to mean stubborn & uncooperative')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: The British shortened this term to "bolshie", which also came to mean stubborn & uncooperative

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [After revealing Vito\'s response] As you know, Abner Doubleday is often credited with inventing baseball, though
it may not be quite so.)

$8,199
RonyWho is U S Grant
$13,200
VitoWho is Abner Doubleday?
$3,000
Abner Doubleday')
